oai_dc:dc.dc:title: TWO-DIMENSIONAL STABILITY ANALYSIS OF TIDAL BASINS AND TIDAL FLATS OF LARGER EXTENT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Renger, Eberhard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: stability analysis
tidal basin
tidal flat
2D stability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stability studies of natural tidal basin system demand a regime-oriented analysis and a characteristic quantification of the morphological values. Hence it was necessary to create relative form parameterization dependent on the location by means of a two-dimensional system of natural coordinates (z =elevation, s = gully length coordinate). The underlying logic for the determination of the equilibrium of the tidal basins and tidal flats is as follows: When the continuity equation for non-steady flow at any cross-section (s; , Zj.) of a tidal basin, within the mean tidal range is applied, a dimensionless relationship between horizontal and vertical cross-sections (A and P) and tide-generated mean velocities of current (Â±u) and tidal rise and fall (+ v) can be derived with an accuracy of more than 90 %.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 16 (1978): Proceedings of 16th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Hamburg, Germany, 1978.; 119
